Hey LinkedIn friends, am too close to a situation, so I need your help.  Daughter had a job interview today and 45 minutes before, as she sat on a bus in the Lincoln Tunnel, the company called and cancelled.  They filled the position.  So help me, is this 2017 business as usual or highly unprofessional?  I am too close to be objective.  Thanks.
Tech writers: I’m looking for advice on selecting a tool for writing user documentation for a Cloud startup.
Here’s what we are looking for:
— Light weight, without a database that requires a backend support team (like Astoria/Oxygen)
— Easy enough for engineers and marketers  to learn quickly and use, as well as tech writers
— Should be cloud-based, so easy to publish on the web, or as online help in a Java service.
Confluence (I’ve used it, it works and is affordable for a small group)
Um, that’s actually the only candidate so far.  Any suggestions? Thanks!
Helping an IT startup design, write and publish technical content for customers and investors.

Within the Partner Marketing team, I worked on courseware for the Facebook Blueprint Program, providing Facebook marketing solutions  to customers and partners through training and education services.

Writer on the Cisco Spark team. Spark delivers a single collaboration experience across all modes of communication: messaging, meeting and calling. All built on the stable and highly secure Cisco platform. Wrote and maintained instructional guides, knowledge-base articles, UI text and short videos for customers of Cisco collaboration products, including Cisco Spark and security solutions Also installation, configuration and maintenance procedures for administrators at various technical levels.We created documents using XML to single source content,  then published to various formats, especially .html and .pdf, primarily using Astoria and  oXygen. Worked closely with cross-functional teams in Design,  Engineering and Product Marketing throughout the world, using Cisco Spark, WebEx and Jabber for real-time collaboration.

Created technical content for Lifecycle Management and Workspace Cloud product offerings including blogs, feature articles, product UI, videos, customer journeys, help and documentation (see recent examples under Publications).

Built a team of tech writers and editors for creating technical documentation for a new developer platform. As part of the Developer Relations team, managed the creation and design of technical content including API reference, developer guides, quick starts, tutorials and marketing content, working in Confluence and Jira. Travelled frequently between Santa Clara CA and Ft. Lauderdale FL to collaborate with engineers, web and marketing teams. Worked with senior directors to define processes, accelerate delivery and guarantee quality of content components for software releases.
Studied russian language under Ben T. Clark.

recommendations: Instructor | Technical Writer  & Trainer | Documentation Project Manager

I am happy to have the opportunity to give a personal recommendation for David (speaking for myself as an individual and not representing Cisco.) I enjoyed working with David as we both supported new end-user applications and related administration & configuration applications. He came into a challenging project that involved many uncertainties, starts, and restarts, as well as changes in management, authoring tools, and delivery platforms; however, he took it in stride. He asked good questions & kept moving in a positive direction, even when the direction kept changing. I found David to be adaptable, agreeable, and team-focused. He does what it takes to meet customers' needs, even when it means adjusting to new demands & putting in extra hours. David also shows an eagerness to collaborate with others to promote new ideas and come up with better solutions. I would love to work with him again sometime!(Required Disclaimer: This reference is being made by me in a personal capacity.  It is not intended and should not be construed as a reference from Cisco Systems Inc. or any of its affiliated entities.  Cisco has not reviewed, approved or endorsed any statement made or information provided by me in this reference and thus is not warranting its accuracy or completeness.)

David is an amazing writer whose talents in the linguistic arts transcends what can be expected from a "normal" content writer. I had the pleasure to work with David on multiple projects and found his ability to swiftly move between different writing genres to be impressive and knowledgeable. From script writing, technical documentation, and user-centric writing, David has helped me take complex technical content, and transform it into creative, educative, and palatable information. I highly recommend David for his work and talent.

David Gleason was one of the most dedicated professionals I have met through our work at Connectix together. I can recommend David as a person with great proficiency and deep background in technical writing and web design, I was amazed at the speed and proficency he was able to complete each project. I highly recommend David and would be happy to speak with anyone interested in more details.

David is one of my favorite people ever.   He epitomizes a team player.  David takes on any challenge and executes to his full ability without complaint.  No task is too big, too small, or too far out of his responsibilities.  Working on a small team in intense conditions is always challenging. Having someone on your team like David - incredibly intelligent, proactive, motivated, funny (if he does say so himself), always has your back - makes the daily grind worth it. David never ceases to amaze me with his wide range of knowledge, experience, enthusiasm, and genuine desire to help others.  I would welcome the opportunity to work with him again.

Instructor | Technical Writer  & Trainer | Documentation Project Manager
March 28, 2017, David reported directly to Laurel

Working for Laurel Beason was the highlight of my time at Cisco. She's the kind of manager I have often wished for: focused, supportive, clear in directives and mission, and a wonderful person to work with. Cisco is a complex and often impenetrable organization for someone who is new. So Laurel started me out with a list of tasks: things to learn, people to meet, tools to explore. She assigned a mentor who knew the ropes and helped me avoid the pitfalls. Laurel then left it to me to come to her when I needed further guidance, but made sure we had weekly check-ins to evaluate my progress. It was a formula for success, despite the complexity and steep learning curve. I will always be grateful to Laurel for her guidance and support!

Principal Technical Writer at Carbon Black, Inc.

Deborah worked as a technical writer for our startup project at Citrix, documenting APIs for a wide range of Windows services, both desktop and mobile. The project was in constant flux, so she worked very hard to create complete and useful documents, only to have the APIs restructured, so she then had to rework the docs as well. Deborah handled this massive workload with patience and professionalism. She made a tremendous contribution, and although the project never saw the light of day, everyone who worked with Deborah remembers and appreciates her efforts.  I recommend her highly as a senior technical writer with a basketful of tools knowledge as well as great technical and interpersonal skills.

summary: Content is king, yet businesses often struggle to get it right. I am a senior content creator specializing in developer, SaaS,  IT and end-user information. I help companies align their content strategy with their objectives, and inform, engage and empower their developers, customers and partners. My experience includes successful platform marketing, documentation, social media, business development, localization, and project management at Apple, LivePerson,  Citrix Systems,  Cisco Systems, and now on a project basis with several companies. An excellent writer and editor, I present complex material clearly and create a strong narrative. Deep experience promoting a platform to software developers through strategic programs, events and targeted technical content. With great people skills, I have built and managed successful teams, and I love figuring out solutions and producing quality results. Specialties: Content strategyContent marketingContent management Technical content creation and curation Platform and API marketing Technical website management Developer event management Developer programsPartner programs Social mediaCommunity buildingEmail marketing and SEOcontent creation, content collection,  content acquisition, project management,  publishing, editing, HTML, web content,  social media, platform marketing, developer tools, IDE, contractor management,  technical writing, marketing writing, feature writing, iOS, Macintosh, Apple Watch, Mac OS X, iPhone, OS X, iPad.
